Junior Backend Developer

Company Name Ignite Online Company Location Melbourne, Australia

Posted Date Posted 6 days ago Number of views 253 views

Job description

Are you a recent graduate/born coder, looking to learn from a leading Melbourne-based digital agency, with a real desire to work as an integral part of a fast-growing team producing epic outcomes?

Ignite Online (igniteonline.com.au) is a web design and digital marketing company based in Collingwood, working out of the inspiring co-working space, 'The Commons' (thecommons.io). We are looking for an experienced junior backend developer with a love of all things online. Your role will be diverse, and you are sure to learn a lot! Check out our Instagram @igniteonline for more of an idea about what we do.

We're looking for somebody passionate about working with us to create and manage innovative digital solutions for our clients! We work with some amazing clients you've heard of like Capi, Melbourne Girls Grammar, AFL Players Association to name a few.

IS THIS YOU?

  • You are a 'learn-it-all' not a 'know-it-all', keen to learn & grow every day.
  • You love coding so much, you're working on your own projects right now in your own time on weeknights or weekends, or taking part in hackathons.
  • You have strong initiative\xa0
  • You love to learn by experimenting, reading books, listening to podcasts or attending\xa0events
  • You pride yourself on your\xa0excellent written and verbal communication and relationship building skills.
  • Near enough is not good enough, you have an eye for detail and strive for perfection.
  • You love your computer,\xa0being online in general and get excited to\xa0test new code and development methodologies.
  • You're a team player that loves to collaborate to get the best results.
  • You are self-motivated and able to work autonomously for periods of time.
  • You're passionate about being organised and planned, armed with your 'to do' lists and timelines.
  • A sense of humour is always welcome!


DO YOU HAVE THESE SKILLS?


  • Some skills in, JavaScript frameworks such as Vue.js or React, HTML5, CSS3

  • Some experience in server-side JavaScript with Node.js\xa0

  • Understanding of Coding best practices - OOP, Design patterns, Data structures etc.\xa0

  • Understanding of single page application (SPA) design patterns\xa0

  • Experience consuming RESTful web services\xa0

  • Experience with front-end build tools, such as Webpack Git version control\xa0

  • Very proficient touch-typing speed

  • MacOSX knowledge

    And it would be great (but not essential) if you have...

  • Good understanding of developing in accordance with WCAG specifications
  • Good understanding of ES6
  • Good understanding of basic SEO code best practices
  • Understanding Deploying and managing internal and external websites within AWS public cloud environment and DevOps, or Cpanel / Apache
  • Unix/Linux; basic commands.
  • Hands on experience in writing unit tests
  • Providing insight into the design process for efficient UX development
  • Basic understanding SASS or similar



KEY RESPONSIBILITIES

  • Working with senior team to deliver industry-leading website projects
  • Experimenting with new and better ways to do things
  • Having direct input into the best strategy for completing a project
  • Ensure high levels of communication are maintained
  • Eliminating cross-browser & device bugs



PERKS


  • Office:\xa0Think Google, we have a modern co-working space in Collingwood with Fussball, arcade games, a garden, free coffee, free beer on tap, free cereal & fruit, yoga & meditation classes! Want to see a video of our space? http://bit.ly/2M5mrkJ
  • Training:\xa0We are always investing in the education of our team, with allowances for learning in a form that best suits you (research, books, Udemy, courses, seminars etc).
  • Latest Gear:\xa0Don't deal with a crappy old PC, we have a brand new iMac for you to work on.
  • Fridays:\xa0We head to the pub for lunch and love an afternoon drink with our co-working neighbours.



PREVIOUS EXPERIENCE


  • Degree or Diploma not mandatory, but you must have a history of learning. Either through General Assembly or online training like Udemy.
  • Computer Science background would be helpful.



REMUNERATION


  • Dependent on experience.



WANT IN?


Just apply through Linkedin and we'll be in touch with next steps.


We will be reviewing all applications at the end of the 30 day period, and will get in touch with successful applicants.


Thank you, we look forward to reviewing your application!

Electrical Engineer | Project Leader | Building Services

Company Name Amida Recruitment Company Location Melbourne, Australia

Posted Date Posted 6 days ago Number of views 111 views

Job description

Electrical Engineer | Project Leader

\xa0

This “ad” is going to read a little different as frankly, this role is a little different. I posted a status update on LinkedIn saying this role is an oxymoron because I ideally need an intermediate level Electrical Engineer for a Project Leader role.

\xa0

Let’s talk about the role first then I’ll tell you about how amazing the company is and more importantly how great the team leader is (he’ll read this so need to pump up his tires). The reason it may seem like an oxymoron is that intermediate engineers don’t generally get the opportunity to lead multidiscipline projects.

\xa0

Herein lies the difference;

\xa0

This role will focus on existing buildings… not small boring fitout projects, existing buildings which can be major commercial towers, hotels, airports or data centres.

\xa0

In a nutshell; Electrical Engineer where level of experience isn’t the key, however you’ll need confidence running your own medium sized projects and you’ll need to enjoy consulting as well as designing.

\xa0

This is an opportunity to work a lot closer with the clients, architects and project managers. An opportunity which will clearly fast track your development.

\xa0

I may seem like I’m about to go off-piste but I’ll try and things back. I just had a coffee with a Principal Engineer at a major building services consultancy. He started his career in a role similar to this one and because of this he is leading major projects with only 8 years’ experience. He honestly said that because he was given the opportunity to lead existing building projects when he was a younger engineer it has made him understand what is required on a larger scale.

\xa0

With regards to the company, all you really need / want to know is that it’s a great place to work and people don’t often leave.

\xa0

But like I always say, don’t take my word for it, sit down for a coffee with that amazingly handsome manager of the team and you’ll appreciate all of what I’m saying as true.

\xa0

For a no strings (or CV) attached conversation call me on 0402 413 428.

Audit Senior / Assistant Manager

Company Name RSM Australia Company Location Melbourne, AU

Posted Date Posted 6 days ago Number of views 150 views

Job description

  • Melbourne CBD Location
  • National Professional Services Firm
  • Career Development Opportunities
About Us

RSM is the 6th largest network of independent audit, tax and consulting firms, encompassing over 120 countries, 800 offices and more than 43,000 people internationally. We have 30 offices throughout Australia and offer personalised services with in-depth expertise and resources in the accountancy, business consulting and risk management areas.

The Opportunity

Due to growth, our Melbourne Risk Advisory division is currently seeking an experienced and enthusiastic Audit Senior or Assistant Manager to join their friendly and supportive team. This position would suit a motivated individual with proven experience in internal audit.

Key Responsibilities Of The Role Include
  • Conducting various audit and assurance engagements simultaneously with numerous engagement team members per audit, including assisting with planning, execution and scheduling staff;
  • Assist in the planning of client deliverables (i.e. strategic internal audit plan, scope documents);
  • Responsible for the execution of fieldwork and documentation of work papers and findings (i.e. maintain the audit file);
  • Identifying and referriong ethical, accounting and conflict issues to manager and/or partner;
  • Summarising the key areas of the engagement for the partner;
  • Identification of findings and issues, and assisting in the drafting of client reports;
  • Assist in business development activities of the firm;
  • Coordination with other divisions;
  • Address technical issues and assist in preparing technical position papers;
  • Undertaking development of team members; and
  • Assisting with management and co-ordination of the audit team including training, mentoring and methodology compliance.
The Successful Applicant
To be considered for this role you must be able to demonstrate the following:
  • Qualified as a Chartered Accountant or near completion;
  • Business / Commerce degree;
  • 2-5 years professional practice experience;
  • IT audit capability or experience (desirable);
  • Well-developed organisational and time management skills;
  • Ability to build rapport with a variety of clients and colleagues;
  • Outstanding communication (verbal and written) skills, including report writing skills
  • Strong attention to detail;
  • Problem solving and decision making skills;
  • Advanced computer skills using Microsoft Products;
  • Working knowledge and application of Australian Audit and Assurance Standards and other applicable legislation; and
  • Flexibility to operate across a wide variety of clients and industries, and to quickly grasp new concepts.

What's On Offer

In this role you will be working within a national Firm and be mentored by experienced Internal Audit practitioners. You will have direct access to and work closely with the Partners and a wide variety of clients and assignments.

RSM provides our employees with the opportunity to connect for success through our culture, employee benefits and an environment that supports work life balance. On offer is a competitive opportunity for personal and professional development and a friendly and supportive environment.

If you're ready for your next career challenge then apply today for this great opportunity.

Capital Projects & Construction Director / Senior Manager– Dubai. To US $200,000 Base + Bonus + benefits. Tax Free

Company Name Consulting Point Company Location Melbourne, Victoria, Australia

Posted Date Posted 6 days ago Number of views 694 views

Job description

*Candidates must be currently working for a tier 1\xa0 consulting at a senior level such as Senior Manager or Director level for a Tier 1 strategy firm, Big 4 or specialist capital projects consultancy like Atkins, Turner & Townsend, Arup etc) to apply to these roles*

\xa0

My client is a global management consultancy who are looking to grow their Capital Projects & Infrastructure (CP&I) team in their Dubai office. All client work with my client in The UAE so this role offers an amazing work-life balance where you come home weekdays (many other consulting firms make you work on long projects is Saudi Arabia or Qatar for example)

The CP&I service are generally offered to clients in the Real Estate and Construction business, specifically focusing on managing risks around construction project development/ construction. Most developers and contractors face challenges around time and cost over runs on the project/ programs. These are largely attributable to the quality of organization/ project governance and availability of information for decision making. Advise of CP&I \xa0professionals would help clients improve the success rate of project developments, even focusing on reduction of time and overall costs.


The CP&I team also works with Investors/ Financiers, who may have exposure either at the project level or company level. The team provides assurance to the Financiers on the health of their investment, providing greater confidence on the time and cost to complete pending projects.


This is a leadership role too where you would be the Head of Capital Projects & Infrastructure (CP&I) for The UAE. My client are keen to hire a candidate Director level who can prove themselves before being promoted to full equity Partnership. There is currently a dedicated team of CP&I professionals and my prestigious client is looking for a senior member to lead and grow this business.


You will be responsible for active business development (60% of time), with the balance towards client and team management. Annual business expectations of a minimum of $2.5 million per annum

\xa0

This is a Director or Senior Manager level position. The candidate should have an experience of minimum 15 years.

\xa0

  • An Engineer background + MBA is desirable
  • 15+ years’ experience of which at least the last 5+ years with a leading professional services firm part of the similar service line
  • Experienced in:
    • Project Management and Strategy: Covers all knowledge areas of project management viz. integration, time, cost, quality, procurement and risk management. It may also cover strategic planning, , strategic alignment with project and program management.
    • Project controls: Experience in major projects planning and controls. Specific experience Include project planning and controls, project risk assessment and management
    • Cost and contract management
  • Should be used to managing a business book of at least $1.5 million per annum
  • Strong practice building traits
  • Preference to somebody who has worked in the region
  • Arabic is a nice to have but not essential
  • Enthusiasm

\xa0

In order to apply for these roles, please email rakesh.pabbi@consultingpoint.com a word version CV and cover letter explaining why you are suitable. You can also call Rakesh on 0780 1179671 / 0207 977 7044. Rakesh is a former PwC & KPMG management consultant and has voted UK Recruiter of the Year for the last 6 years running – 2012, 2013, 2014, 2015, 2016 & 2017




Consulting Point Search is a multi-award winning talent advisory and search firm, headquartered in the UK, with a global presence and network. We have specialised in management consultancy since 2003 and operate across all industry verticals and services lines. The firm was founded by ‘Big 4’ management consultants to combine industry experience with talent acquisition and search excellence. We work on assignments for leading strategy houses, Big 4, specialist consultancies, private equity firms and internal consulting divisions within major firms across the globe, recruiting permanent and interim staff at all levels from analyst to global partners and C-level executives.


We have attained industry recognition including being voted “Top management consultancy recruitment firm” in 2014, 2015, 2016 and 2017 and acknowledged as having the greatest candidate reach in management consultancy of any UK based firm. \xa0

Job description

Green Light Worldwide are currently looking for an experienced ServiceNow Consultant to join our delivery team in Melbourne. The ServiceNow Consultant will be required to have the competence to design, develop, maintain, enhance, monitor and support ServiceNow.

\xa0

The ServiceNow Consultant will be accountable for the successful design and delivery of technical ServiceNow solutions that meet the business needs. Job description

  • The role is based in Gippsland, Victoria. \xa0We offer relocation assistance. \xa0\xa0
  • Full Time, Fixed Term position 12 months
  • We offer\xa0excellent terms and conditions including salary packaging


About the role:


An excellent opportunity exists for a New Graduate or experienced Grade 1 Physiotherapist to join the Allied Health Team at Central Gippsland Health (CGH).\xa0


This position offers the opportunity to obtain experience with a mixed caseload, across hospital and community settings and in a thriving and vibrant rural health setting. This position offers a varied and interesting caseload that includes acute, subacute, community and aged care services. This position will include work over multiple sites of CGH due to an expanding subacute and aged care service.

\xa0

The successful applicant will work with a multi-disciplinary health and community services team who see the client at the centre of their care. This caseload will encompass individual and group work in an inpatient and outpatient setting.

\xa0

CGH is the major provider of health and residential aged care services in the Wellington Shire and is an integrated health service. We have a wide range of primary health and community support services in addition to the acute hospital services. Central Gippsland presents a large number of amenities that provide a great lifestyle for all with close access to beaches, parklands and snow.

\xa0

The CGH Allied Health Department has a staff establishment of more than 40 effective full-time positions, based in a purpose-built Rehabilitation facility. The Physiotherapy Department has 6 full time and 2 part-time Physiotherapists. There is a Clinical Lead Physiotherapist along with five Grade 2 therapists and 2 other Grade 1 therapists. There is also an Exercise Physiologist and qualified and experienced Allied Health Assistants.

\xa0

The role will require commitment to providing leading-edge physiotherapy practices, as well as a passion for client centred care coordination. This position is rotational with areas of service delivery including rehabilitation, general medical, surgical, paediatrics, clinical care, community outpatients and groups.

  • Current registration with the Australian Health Practitioner Regulation Agency (AHPRA)
  • Proven clinical experience
  • Victorian Drivers License
  • Clear police check

Childcare Centre Director

Company Name Guardian Early Learning Group Company Location South Melbourne, Victoria, Australia

Posted Date Posted 7 days ago Number of views 51 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

Child Care Centre Manger| South Melbourne |Brand New Centre


Guardian is very pleased to announce that due to the highly anticipated opening of our brand-new state of the art centre we are welcoming applications for the role of Centre Manager

Located on Tope Street, the centre is conveniently located within 300m walking distance of both Park Street and Sturt Street light rail stations. The centre is due to open in January 2019, this is your opportunity to be integral in the creation of inspirational learning spaces and building your new team.


Spread across three levels this 120-place centre will sit above Melbourne’s skyline giving up unparallel views of the city. This custom-built and architecturally designed space will offer expansive indoor/outdoor play areas. We will have a commercial grade kitchen that will be used as a learning environment, featuring an open servery. Parents will be invited for breakfast and meals will be shared together in the piazza.


Architecturally designed to offer a nurturing and stimulating early learning environment for children aged 6 weeks to 6 years. \xa0It will be equipped with Reggio-inspired materials, high quality, natural resources with huge windows which will connect the children with the community and their surroundings. On the 3rd level the centre will also feature a well-resourced atelier on the roof top yard, where children can express their creative skills.


Your role as Centre Manager\xa0


As a Centre Manger, you will have ultimate responsibility for the overall performance of your centre, measured against the:


  • The development of a quality service and pedagogical leadership
  • Team leadership, development and educator engagement
  • Parent satisfaction and feedback
  • Establishing meaningful connections within the community and your families
  • Use of marketing initiatives to drive occupancy
  • Financial outcomes

We are looking for a dynamic and skilled Centre Manager who has the experience of opening new centres. \xa0You will be a leader who enjoys building meaningful relationships with the community and who can inspire and motivate a new team.


To be considered for this role the following will be a highly-regarded industry professional. You will have:


  • A minimum of 5 years’ experience as an Early Years Centre Manager, managing large teams
  • Demonstrated experience opening a new ELC centre.
  • Working knowledge of the National Quality Framework, regulations and the Early Years Learning Framework.
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills
  • The ability to inspire, motivate and maintain a positive learning culture within the Centre for children and their families and for your team of Educators
  • Experience working to and delivering budget targets
  • A Nominated / Certified Supervisor Certificate
  • Experience taking a centre/s through Assessment and Rating process


Guardian has a dedicated central support function with over 100 team members located in both Melbourne and Sydney. Victorian Centre Managers have access to our very own Pedagogy Exchange Centre. Visit this link to read more \xa0https://www.guardian.edu.au/learning-guardian/guardian-pedagogical-exchange/


Our Centre Managers are encouraged to run their centres with a high degree of autonomy. Centre Managers who thrive at Guardian are those with a strong vision for their centre, who are good with people, who aren't afraid to make decisions and to speak their mind and who strive to running their Centres at full occupancy.

Xmas Casual │ Retail Consultant │ Highpoint

Company Name Optus Company Location Melbourne, AU

Posted Date Posted 1 week ago Number of views 50 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

Here at Optus Retail, we’re excited about the potential for new ideas and new approaches to improve people’s lives and we’re looking for a Retail Consultant who feels the same.

The role

We’re currently looking for a Retail Consultant who is looking for a career or lifestyle change, to achieve a positive work/life balance.

As a Retail Consultant at Optus you can bring your wealth of experience to our stores. You’ll love to chat and have a genuine interest in people and their story. You’ll be responsible for setting Optus apart through your friendliness and positivity. It’s also imperative that you love contributing to a high performing team culture and enjoy keeping up to date with new products and services.

The perks

We offer personal development and formal on-the-job training, as well as an attractive salary package. You don’t need to understand phones and networks; we’ll give you all the training and development needed to be effective. As we move beyond the role of a traditional telco, we have new challenges and opportunities for those looking to join in, take them on and grow with us.

About You

We’re looking for reliable people who have valuable work and life experience and are ready to put those skills to use in a busy retail environment. Successful people in our stores come from diverse backgrounds, we’re looking for;
  • Communication - A great personality to provide incredible customer experiences
  • People Focus - You’re a listener and relationship builder, who can problem solve in a fast-paced environment
  • This is a sales role, so bring your solid experience of working with KPIs and targets
  • You’ll also have an interest in telecommunications


About Us

At Optus, we don’t sit back and let the future happen to us – we’re out there making it. By expanding into new technology and relentlessly improving every day, we’re creating a better tomorrow for all Australians. Apply now to join us.

Optus believes in the strength of a vibrant, diverse and inclusive workforce where backgrounds, perspectives and life experiences of our people help us innovate and create strong connections with our customers.

Senior Consultant - IT Audit

Company Name PwC Australia Company Location Melbourne, AU

Posted Date Posted 6 days ago Number of views 54 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

  • Flexible work options - work smarter in a way that suits your lifestyle
  • Opportunity to work with top ASX clients
  • Agile, diverse & inclusive team

Join PwC's Risk Assurance team as a Senior Consultant within IT Audit and foster relationships with clients and help them to strengthen their technology risk profile.

The Opportunity

At PwC, we help Australian businesses, not-for-profits and governments create value and improve the way they work. From improving healthcare, to creating smarter cities and igniting Australia's start up industry, you'll build trust in society and solve important problems.

The Risk Assurance team brings this to life by developing technology and risk management strategies and methodologies for a wide range of clients. As the Senior Consultant your impact will be seen by managing a portfolio of clients and providing expert technology risk advice.

Success does stem from a positive attitude, hard work and going the extra mile, but that's not all!

You will
  • Build on your existing technology risk skills by working with a team of professionals
  • Strengthen internal controls and risk management processes
  • Have a commercial mindset and drive to solve important problems

About You

The brief is simple...

You have a solid background in technology risk and are capable of partnering with IT and Audit professionals to deliver the best outcomes to our clients. You're passionate about identifying priority areas of risk and process improvement by understanding the organisation's systems, objectives, risks, control framework and regulatory environment to prevent future loss. You thrive in a collaborative and innovative culture and want to join a firm that values problem solvers, the kind of people who reimagine the possible for their clients and key stakeholders.

Your colleagues can vouch that you
  • Act with integrity and show care for the people you work with
  • Demonstrate an ability to foster relationships internally and externally
  • Have 3-5 years of controls experience gained working in IT Audit
  • Assist in the development of risk management strategies and methodologies
  • Technical skills in controls, risk and technology reviews

Sound like you? Read on.

What We Offer

Working for Australia's largest professional services firm you'll join a global network spanning 157 countries that delivers meaningful outcomes for a wide range of clients.

Our culture and benefits are why we're LinkedIn's number one Australian workplace. With state of the art offices and premium technology, each person has access to flexible work options. The dress policy is flexible too - you choose what you wear based on the work you do with your team and clients.

Fostering an inclusive culture and embracing differences is at the core of everything we do. PwC empowers you to be yourself and work with people from many backgrounds to achieve things never thought possible. Get involved in our employee-led diversity networks (cultural, disability, LGBTI or gender equality) and benefit from our best-in-class policies such as 18 weeks maternity/paternity leave, flexible work and gender equity.

Up for a challenge? We're committed to helping our people unleash their potential. Hard work doesn't go unrewarded and industry best coaching, mentoring, training and development are ready and waiting. If you hold a genuine desire to make a difference and want to surround yourself with like-minded, talented and driven individuals who strive to do the same, apply now.

PwC is committed to building and maintaining a diverse workforce. Our Reconciliation Action Plan sets out our commitment to increase Indigenous employment. We encourage applications from Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander Australians.

Andy Hinton is the Recruitment Manager for the role. As the team experience high volumes of applications, we appreciate your patience to allow for a timely and fair process for all.

We welcome the opportunity to speak to candidates about our value proposition and recognition and reward approach. The minimum full time salary for this role is Sixty-Five thousand and Seven hundred Fifty-three Australian dollars including 9.5% Superannuation, however will be determined based on the skills and experience that the candidate brings.

Melbourne

  • Accounting
  • Financial Services

Job description

Job Description

DXC Technology (NYSE: DXC) is the world’s leading independent, end-to-end IT services company, helping clients harness the power of innovation to thrive on change. Created by the merger of CSC and the Enterprise Services business of Hewlett Packard Enterprise, DXC Technology serves nearly 6,000 private and public sector clients across 70 countries. The company’s technology independence, global talent and extensive partner alliance combine to deliver powerful next-generation IT services and solutions. DXC Technology is recognized among the best corporate citizens globally. For more information, visit www.dxc.technology .

Roles Across Sydney, Melbourne and Adelaide

Responsibilities
  • Responsible for supply chain processes, such as inventory analysis, order fulfillment, import/export operations and shipping, for a country or regional business unit with minimum supervision applying discretion and judgement.
  • Compiles key metrics, produces reports, and analyzes data using IT systems for demand and supply matching activities.
  • Analysis of backlog management.
  • Gathers demand data from country and region for demand planning.
  • Reviews current business process for regional and global business unit planning teams.
  • Reviews performance metrics on a regular basis, identifying opportunities for improvement.

Education And Experience Required
  • First level university degree or equivalent experience.
  • Typically 0-2 years of experience in a supply chain function.

Knowledge And Skills
  • Good understanding of supply chain processes (plan, source, make deliver).
  • Demonstrated analytical skills.
  • Strong written and verbal communication skills; mastery in English and local language.
  • Good interpersonal skills.
  • Basic Microsoft Office skills (Excel, PowerPoint, etc.).
  • Basic understanding of project management methodology.
  • Developing business acumen and technical knowledge within area of responsibility.
  • Introduction to the company's overall supply chain strategy.
  • Basic understanding of Material Requirements Planning (MRP) and ATP.
  • Basic understanding of import/export regulatory requirements and compliance.
  • Basic knowledge of inventory analysis.

Job description

We are looking for a talented Social Media Content & Manager Content Copywriter to join our team.\xa0

WHY WORK FOR 3 PHASE MARKETING?


- Exposure to every facet of marketing and advertising
- Supportive management and mentors to ensure your success\xa0
- Professional development opportunities, a personal budget of $3,000 every year \xa0
- Great culture and positive team
- Chadstone location, the Fashion Capital
- Part of the Waterman Business Centre, ultra modern state of the art facilities \xa0
- Free onsite parking


YOUR DUTIES


- Manage and implement content within the social calendar across a number of luxury automotive brands including Mercedes-Benz, Jaguar, Land Rover and Audi dealerships\xa0

- Ensure posts, images and copy are consistent with brand guidelines\xa0

- Create copy for eDMs, blogs, radio scripts, campaigns, and marketing material \xa0
- Support Social Media team by proofreading content on a weekly basis\xa0

- Deliver a superior level of customer service to our clients\xa0


SKILLS | EXPERIENCE | QUALIFICATIONS

- Minimum two years experience working in a media/marketing agency \xa0
- Demonstrated success with creative copywriting and persuasive language\xa0
- Excellent communication skills both written and verbal \xa0
- Fast learner, flexible with a positive can-do attitude
- A love of thinking outside the box and developing creative/innovative solutions\xa0

- Fast pace work style without compromising quality\xa0


ABOUT US\xa0


3 Phase Marketing, a progressive full-service agency, is looking for a smart, capable and focused digital marketing professional who has a passion for the automotive industry. You'll be responsible for the development and execution of strategic social media campaigns from design and copy through to implementation.
